:sprocket: :surfer: Heads up HubSpot Devs!:sprocket: :surfer:

While this Developer Slack is a peer to peer networking and discussion space and *not* a HubSpot support space, we still wanted y'all to be aware that, in our commitment to long-term success and prevention of burnout...

HubSpot is taking our *<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Announcements/It-s-Almost-Time-for-HubSpot-s-Global-Week-of-Rest-July-3-7-2023/ba-p/810324|annual week of rest next week>*, so getting in touch with us from *EOD today until July 10th will be extremely limited*.

This is especially relevant to anyone working on any betas through this Slack, but we wanted you all to be generally aware as well. Our support team will course be available for any emergencies or mission critical issues that may arise (*knock on wood)* but next week will not be business as usual. See all the specifics <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Announcements/It-s-Almost-Time-for-HubSpot-s-Global-Week-of-Rest-July-3-7-2023/ba-p/810324|here>.

Please continue to support each other as you do so well in this community while we're out -  and we're looking forwarding to connecting with you all again, refreshed and renewed, for the 2nd half of 2023, on July 10th!
Thanks, Magnus. We are actively considering charts

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
love it, anything thoughts on a custom styled plotly js chart?

Hey Hub-Devs:flywheel:! Hoping this awesome community can provide some advice on HubSpot capabilities with Kafka..

:mario_question:: Does HubSpot have the capability to publish events and/or leads directly to Kafka?
If so, could anyone share docs/articles or some bullets of how this works?

Use case: We’re having leads generated in HubSpot and the idea is to have a framework which listens to kafka topics for incoming leads, then HS can publish the leads directly into Kafka
